meanings.sent1: She ran quickly and shoved the door open.
meanings.sent2: He angrily shoved the chair out of his way.
meanings.sent3: The wind playfully shoved the leaves around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The waves of the storm shoved the boat towards the shore.
meanings.sent5: The bully shoved the smaller kid to the ground.

meanings.sent1: The car suddenly shoved to a stop at the red light.
meanings.sent2: She clumsily shoved the books into her bag.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully shoved the ball across the room.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake shoved the buildings back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The wind forcefully shoved the door closed.

meanings.sent1: He shoved the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent2: She shoved her way through the crowded hallway.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel comically shoved the acorn into its mouth.
meanings.sent4: The knight bravely shoved the enemy back with his shield.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind shoved the tree branches back and forth.
